column1: Kamen (German: [ˈkaːmən] (listen)) is a town in North Rhine-Westphalia
Kamen is situated at the east end of the Ruhr area
column2: approximately 10 km south-west of Hamm and 25 km north-east of Dortmund.

Kamen is maybe most known because of the nearby highway crossing
column2: the Kamener Kreuz. The north-south directed A1 meets the east-west directed A2; due to the importance of both highways the crossing is prone for traffic jams.

column1: The village Kamen-Methler is well known for its football training camps. The German football team prepared themselves for the 1990 World Cup win in Kamen-Methler. During the soccer world championship 2006 in Germany the Spanish football team lived there.
